level_info.name: Programming Terminology
level_info.description: Learn essential programming terms and concepts

questions.explanation: IDE stands for Integrated Development Environment - a software application that provides comprehensive facilities for software development. Popular IDEs include Visual Studio Code, PyCharm, IntelliJ IDEA, and Eclipse.

questions.question_text: What is Git primarily used for?
options: Version control and tracking code changes
questions.explanation: Git is a distributed version control system used to track changes in source code during software development.

options: The rules that define valid code structure
questions.explanation: Syntax refers to the set of rules that defines the combinations of symbols that are considered valid in a programming language.

options: The process of finding and fixing errors in code
questions.explanation: Debugging is the process of identifying, analyzing, and removing errors (bugs) from computer programs to ensure they work correctly.
API stands for Application Programming Interface - a set of protocols and tools that allows different software applications to communicate with each other.

options: A tool that finds bugs in code
A program that translates source code into machine code
questions.explanation: A compiler is a program that translates source code written in a high-level programming language into machine code that can be executed by a computer's processor.

options: Software with source code freely available for modification
Software that runs on any operating system
questions.explanation: Open source refers to software whose source code is freely available for anyone to view, modify, and distribute, promoting collaboration and transparency in software development.

options: A storage location for software packages and code
questions.explanation: A repository is a storage location where code, documentation, and other project files are kept and managed, often using version control systems like Git.

options: Restructuring existing code without changing its functionality
Converting code to a different programming language
questions.explanation: Refactoring is the process of restructuring existing code to improve its readability, maintainability, or performance without changing its external behavior or functionality.
